squidpony.panel

Class ICombinedPanel.Impl<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • squidpony.panel.ICombinedPanel.Impl<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of colors.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICombinedPanel<T>
    Enclosing interface:
    ICombinedPanel<T>

    @Beta
public static class ICombinedPanel.Impl<T>
extends Object
implements ICombinedPanel<T>
    A generic implementation of ICombinedPanel. Useful to combine things. If you're a new user, you likely would prefer the more specific implementation using libGDX, GroupCombinedPanel, instead.
    Author:
    smelC

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Impl

        public Impl(ISquidPanel<T> bg,
            ISquidPanel<T> fg,
            int width,
            int height)
        Parameters:
        bg - The backing background panel.
        fg - The backing foreground panel.
        width - The width of this panel, used for fillBG(Object) (so that it fills within [0, width)).
        height - The height of this panel, used for fillBG(Object) (so that it fills within [0, height)).
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - In various cases of errors regarding sizes of panels.

      • putFG

        public void putFG(int x,
                  int y,
                  String string,
                  T foreground)
        Description copied from interface: ICombinedPanel
        Puts the given string horizontally with the first character at the given offset. Does not word wrap. Characters that are not renderable (due to being at negative offsets or offsets greater than the grid size) will not be shown but will not cause any malfunctions.
        Specified by:
        putFG in interface ICombinedPanel<T>
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the first character
        y - the y coordinate of the first character
        string - the characters to be displayed
        foreground - the color to draw the characters

      • putFG

        public void putFG(int x,
                  int y,
                  IColoredString<T> cs)
        Description copied from interface: ICombinedPanel
        Puts the given string horizontally with the first character at the given offset. Does not word wrap. Characters that are not renderable (due to being at negative offsets or offsets greater than the grid size) will not be shown but will not cause any malfunctions.
        Specified by:
        putFG in interface ICombinedPanel<T>
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the first character
        y - the y coordinate of the first character
        cs - the text to be displayed, with its color.

      • fillBG

        public void fillBG(T color)
        Convenience method that fills the background with the given color. Equivalent to calling ICombinedPanel.fill(What, Object) with ICombinedPanel.What.BG as the first parameter.
        Parameters:
        color - the color to fill the background with

      • hasActiveAnimations

        public boolean hasActiveAnimations()
        Specified by:
        hasActiveAnimations in interface ICombinedPanel<T>
        Returns:
        Returns true if there are animations running when this method is called.
